sources.title: The Vanishing Riders
sources.description: Title: The Vanishing Riders Summary: Sheriff Bill Jones, in the line of duty, kills outlaw Joe Land and adopts his young son, Tim. They come upon a former silver boomtown, reputed to be haunted, whose only inhabitant is Hiram ... Directed by: Robert F. Hill Actors: Production Company: Ray Kirkwood Productions Release Date: 3 July 1935 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Sheriff Bill Jones, in the line of duty, kills outlaw Joe Land and adopts his young son, Tim. They come upon a former silver boomtown, reputed to be haunted, whose only inhabitant is Hiram McDuff, a friend of Bill's. Ranch owner Joan Stanley hires Bill and Tim. Her father has been killed by the gang of Wolf Larson. By mistake, McDuff hires the Larson gang on as ranch hands for Joan. They plan to steal the stock while Bill is away. Tim overhears the plot and informs Bill. Bill and Tim use ghost makeup, skeleton sheets (even outfitting their horses with skeleton-looking blankets) and tricks to rout the superstitious gang members...

sources.title: The Vanishing Riders (1935)
sources.description: A pair of cowboys dress up as ghosts to battle a gang of cattle rustlers.

sources.title: The Vanishing Riders (1935) BILL CODY
sources.description:
Stars: Bill Cody, Bill Cody Jr., Ethel Jackson
Director: Robert F. Hill

Bill Jones and his newly adopted son has a plan that uses the gang's fear of ghosts to bring them in.

TRIVIA: Born William Joseph Cody on January 5, 1891, in St. Paul, Minnesota, he became a popular cowboy star during the 1920s and 1930s. Cody is often associated with the B-Western genre, where he played the heroic cowboy figure, a staple of American cinema during that period.

metadata.Plot: Sheriff Bill Jones, in the line of duty, kills outlaw Joe Land and adopts his young son, Tim. They come upon a former silver boomtown, reputed to be haunted, whose only inhabitant is Hiram McDuff, a friend of Bill's. Ranch owner Joan Stanley hires Bill and Tim. Her father has been killed by the gang of Wolf Larson. By mistake, McDuff hires the Larson gang on as ranch hands for Joan. They plan to steal the stock while Bill is away. Tim overhears the plot and informs Bill. Bill and Tim use ghost makeup, skeleton sheets (even outfitting their horses with skeleton-looking blankets) and tricks to rout the superstitious gang members...
metadata.Actors: Bill Cody, Bill Cody Jr., Ethel Jackson
